title: The Last Bunker on Earth
premise: When a global catastrophe forces humanity into a network of underground bunkers, a cynical tech CEO and a bleeding-heart environmental activist discover they've been assigned to the same single-occupancy survival unit. With the world locked down for a mandatory 5-year quarantine, their battle for control of the thermostat turns into a war of wills—and the only way to preserve their sanity might be to surrender their hearts.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a fiercely idealistic botanist who sabotaged the CEO's company for its ecological crimes just before the apocalypse.
conflict: They must cooperate to manage their bunker's failing life-support systems, all while hiding their true identities and grappling with the guilt of their past enmity, as the close quarters and shared peril make their hatred feel dangerously like something else.
setting: A near-future, state-of-the-art personal survival bunker, buried deep beneath what was once the Pacific Northwest, during a mandatory global isolation period.
tone: Claustrophobic, witty, and electrically tense, evolving into deeply emotional and redemptive.
